dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 769 IH: To designate the National Museum of the Mighty Eighth Air Force in Pooler, Georgia, as the official National Museum of the Mighty Eighth Air Force in the United States, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Carter of Georgia (for himself, Mr. Crenshaw, Mr. Wittman, Mr. Clyde, Mr. Johnson of Ohio, and Mr. Austin Scott of Georgia) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To designate the National Museum of the Mighty Eighth Air Force in Pooler, Georgia, as the official National Museum of the Mighty Eighth Air Force in the United States, and for other purposes.

section.header: National museum of the Mighty Eighth Air Force

subsection.text: The National Museum of the Mighty Eighth Air Force located at 175 Bourne Avenue, Pooler, Georgia (or any successor location), is designated as the official National Museum of the Mighty Eighth Air Force of the United States (referred to in this section as the National Museum).
The National Museum shall not be included as a unit of the National Park System.
This section shall not be construed to appropriate, or authorize the appropriation of, Federal funds for any purpose related to the National Museum.
